data.text: @softhearted_boy @Swamy39 @Krishh1963 @Dharma4X Read the graph. These are projections, not growth rate. Plus, it ignores the large decline for the year 2020-2021 as a result of which 2021 is a rebound.
@Dharma4X @Swamy39 ..  in that light. Will follow up later. Thank you.

@Dharma4X @Swamy39 ..  3 yrs, gave a boost for 4 yrs, sagged for 3 yrs for political/chinavirus reasons, and is building up for a robust economic future with "Make in India," Atmanirbhar, massive infra buildup, skill development etc. It's the for the long haul, and should be judged as well(4/5)

@Dharma4X @Swamy39 terrible delta wave passed. We should see robust growth in the coming year. The deceleration from 2017-18 FY probably was at least partly from demonetization & some Trump's protectionism.

Modi's economy pulled India out of the horribly stagnant and inflationary UPA2's final(3/4)

@Dharma4X @Swamy39 So things were volatile internally/externally. Foreign investment (FDI) was a bit jittery during that period, I believe. The initial, long chinavirus lockdown had a big impact on several non-agro sectors. Things appear to be recovering well since lockdowns were eased & the(2/n)

@Swamy39 In a VHS Arth Gyan Ganga Show, Dr. @Swamy39 Ji briefed PTs using a graph that Economy slowdown was prevalent in Bharat before the impact of Covid-19 and national lockdown.. 🍀🌟

Dr. @Swamy39 Ji highlighted that GDP Growth Rate in Q4, 2019-20 was in fact 3.10% 🍀🌟 https://t.co/z7VZkWHXzf
@Swamy39 @Dharma4X Is this the first time on planet earth?? Economic slow downs are part of life.
@Krishh1963 @Swamy39 @Dharma4X It all happened because of the mistakes made 69 years ago (1947) and the ruling party before 2014.
@Krishh1963 @Swamy39 @Dharma4X Sir I appreciate Government to maintain atleast this GDP level  in these distress time of two years of pandamic, now economic impact due to war.
